word: PAGE 21: MESMERISM.--IN ORDER TO JUSTIFY THEIR OPPOSITION, SOME EARLY ENEMIES OF THE VISIONS SUGGESTED THAT ELLEN WHITE'S EXPERIENCE WAS BROUGHT ABOUT THROUGH MESMERISM, A PHENOMENON KNOWN TODAY AS HYPNOSIS. HYPNOSIS IS A STATE RESEMBLING SLEEP, INDUCED THROUGH THE POWER OF SUGGESTION, THE HYPNOTIZED SUBJECT BEING IN RAPPORT WITH THE ONE INDUCING THE STATE AND RESPONSIVE TO HIS SUGGESTIONS. WHEN, HOWEVER, AS MRS. WHITE HERE REPORTS, A MESMERIZING PHYSICIAN ATTEMPTED TO HYPNOTIZE HER, HE WAS HELPLESS IN HER PRESENCE.
